fitContent.description: Set fitContent to true to optimize the dynamic page responsiveness on small screens and behavior when the DynamicPageHeader is expanded or collapsed.

visible.description: Allows you to define if the button is visible on the screen.

type.description: Use type to define the table type. Note: Grid tables, analytical tables, and tree tables cannot be rendered on smartphones. Instead, responsive tables always show on smartphones.

growingThreshold.description: growingThreshold defines the number of items to be requested from the model for each grow. This property can only be used if the growing property is set to true.

qualifier.description: Represents the SelectionPresentationVariant qualifier. ALP looks for SelectionPresentationVariant with this qualifier and if not found, it looks for PresentationVariant with this qualifier.

defaultContentView.description: Determines the visualization of content area

defaultFilterMode.description: Determines the filter mode that is used

contentTitle.description: Lets you define title for the content area
contentTitle.i18nClassification: TIT: Title for the content area

autoHide.description: This setting allows developer to determine chart / table interaction. 'true' would mean chart act as filter for table, 'false' would mean that matching table rows are highlighted but table is not filtered.

allFiltersAsInParameters.description: All filter fields will be set as in parameter

multiSelect.description: Single selection in tables is enabled by default. If you want, you can enable multi-select.

createWithParameterDialog.description: You can enable the creation of objects that have a maximum of 8 data fields through a dialog in the list report page.

selectAll.description: The 'Select All' button is disabled by default. To enable it, set selectAll to true.

selectionLimit.description: If new data needs to be loaded from the back-end system for this, the number of lines to be loaded is restricted to the specified limit. The default value for this limit is 200. If selectAll is true, the selection limit is not evaluated.

showTablePersonalisation.description: The showTablePersonalisation attribute can be set to false to hide the table personalization button.

useExportToExcel.description: useExportToExcel must be set to true if you want to export data to a spreadsheet application, for example Microsoft Excel.

exportType.description: Specifies the type of export to be used in the SmartTable control. UI5Client is the default option.

fitContainer.description: Set to false if the table does not occupy the entire space available in the container.

copy.description:
If copy is set to true, the Copy to Clipboard button is shown in the table toolbar.
By default, the Copy to Clipboard button is displayed in the table toolbar if the selection mode is configured for the corresponding table.

quickVariantSelection.description: With quickVariantSelection you can switch on the multiple view feature. It links to variants you must have added to your annotations beforehand.

quickVariantSelectionX.description: Switch on the multiple view feature (Multiple table mode with charts) and link to the variants you have added to your annotations.

condensedTableLayout.description: For analytical tables, grid tables and tree tables you can define a condensed table layout by setting condensedTableLayout to true.

enableTableFilterInPageVariant.description:
If you have enabled harmonized variant management, by default, you cannot set a filter in the table personalization settings.
To enable filtering, set the enableTableFilterInPageVariant property to true.

dataLoadSettings.description: Change the default behavior for autoloading of data.

smarttable.ExportType.description: Provides the type of services available for export in the `SmartTable` control.

showCounts.description: To show the number of records available, set showCounts to true.

variants.description: The variants section contains a set of entries that point to SelectionVariants or SelectionPresentationVariants defined in the annotations.

key.description: A key entry that is used for initializing the corresponding SegmentedButton item. This entry is mandatory.

annotationPath.description: Use annotationPath to define a specific variant that points to a SelectionVariant or SelectionPresentationVariant annotation.

enableAutoBinding.description: When set to true, this enables automatic binding of the table with either the tableBindingPath (if it exists) or the entitySet property.

variants.description: The variants section contains a set of entries that point to SelectionVariants or SelectionPresentationVariants defined in the annotations.

showCounts.description: To show the number of records available, set showCounts to true.

entitySet.description: Represents the entity set that will be displayed in this variant

multiSelect.description: Single selection in tables is enabled by default. If you want, you can enable multi-select.

selectAll.description: The 'Select All' button is disabled by default. To enable it, set selectAll to true.

selectionLimit.description: If new data needs to be loaded from the back-end system for this, the number of lines to be loaded is restricted to the specified limit. The default value for this limit is 200. If selectAll is true, the selection limit is not evaluated.

type.description: Use type to define the table type. Note: Grid tables, analytical tables, and tree tables cannot be rendered on smartphones. Instead, responsive tables always show on smartphones.

showItemNavigationOnChart.description: To enable navigation for charts, you have to set the property to "true" and maintain an internal navigation target in the manifest.

inlineDelete.description: Used to enable inline deletion in a responsive table of list report and object page

key.description: A key entry that is used for initializing the corresponding SegmentedButton item. This entry is mandatory.

annotationPath.description: Use annotationPath to define a specific variant that points to a SelectionVariant or SelectionPresentationVariant annotation.

loadDataOnAppLaunch.description:
Change the default behavior for autoloading of data.
For multi-view scenarios, you can also change the setting enableAutobinding to False under quickVariantSelectionX instead of using the loadDataOnAppLaunch setting.

tooltip.description: The text of the button tooltip, preferably as an i18n key.
tooltip.i18nClassification: ACT: Text for tooltip of button.

icon.description: An icon to be displayed as a graphical element within the button. This can be an image or an icon from the icon font (https://ui5.sap.com/test-resources/sap/m/demokit/iconExplorer/webapp/index.html#/overview/SAP-icons), represented as RFC 3986 conformant URI.

activeIcon.description: An alternative icon for the active (depressed) state of the button. This can be an image or an icon from the icon font (https://ui5.sap.com/test-resources/sap/m/demokit/iconExplorer/webapp/index.html#/overview/SAP-icons), represented as RFC 3986 conformant URI.

ButtonType.description: Different predefined button types for the {@link sap.m.Button sap.m.Button}.

width.description: The width property defines the width of the column.

hAlign.description: The hAlign property defines the horizontal alignment of the column content.

tooltip.description: The text of the button tooltip, preferably as an i18n key.
tooltip.i18nClassification: ACT: Text for tooltip of button.

icon.description: An icon to be displayed as a graphical element within the button. This can be an image or an icon from the icon font (https://ui5.sap.com/test-resources/sap/m/demokit/iconExplorer/webapp/index.html#/overview/SAP-icons), represented as RFC 3986 conformant URI.

activeIcon.description: An alternative icon for the active (depressed) state of the button. This can be an image or an icon from the icon font (https://ui5.sap.com/test-resources/sap/m/demokit/iconExplorer/webapp/index.html#/overview/SAP-icons), represented as RFC 3986 conformant URI.

width.description: The width property defines the width of the column.

hAlign.description: The hAlign property defines the horizontal alignment of the column content.

id.description: In case the fragment needs to be re-used for multiple tabs, the id property must be set to make the ids unique.

text.description: The label of the custom column, preferably as an i18n key.

columnIndex.description: The index of the column in the overall collection; if undefined, the custom column will be added at the end of the table.

leadingProperty.description: If the content of your custom column refers to a property (such as{Price}), you need to include a corresponding 'leadingProperty' entry in the column definition.

className.description: The UI5 control used for your extension

fragmentName.description: The relative path to your fragment with path segments separated by '.'. The first element is the app ID.

cellsFragmentName.description: In case of a responsive table, you additionally need to specify a fragment for the table cells.

tabKey.description: If you use QuickVariantSelectionX, you need to define the extensions per tab. 'tabKey' is the key provided when defining the QuickVariantSelectionX.

extensionType.description: Type of custom column view extension.

type.description: Use type to define the table type. Note: Grid tables, analytical tables, and tree tables cannot be rendered on smartphones. Instead, responsive tables always show on smartphones.

qualifier.description: Represents the SelectionPresentationVariant qualifier. ALP looks for SelectionPresentationVariant with this qualifier and if not found, it looks for PresentationVariant with this qualifier.

defaultFilterMode.description: Determines the filter mode that is used

If copy is set to true, the Copy to Clipboard button is shown in the table toolbar.
By default, the Copy to Clipboard button is displayed in the table toolbar if the selection mode is configured for the corresponding table.

quickVariantSelection.description: With quickVariantSelection you can switch on the multiple view feature. It links to variants you must have added to your annotations beforehand.

quickVariantSelectionX.description: Switch on the multiple view feature (Multiple table mode with charts) and link to the variants you have added to your annotations.

condensedTableLayout.description: For analytical tables, grid tables and tree tables you can define a condensed table layout by setting condensedTableLayout to true.

enableTableFilterInPageVariant.description:
If you have enabled harmonized variant management, by default, you cannot set a filter in the table personalization settings.
To enable filtering, set the enableTableFilterInPageVariant property to true.

dataLoadSettings.description: Change the default behavior for autoloading of data.

showGoButtonOnFilterBar.description: Go button is displayed for compact filters when this is set to true

filterDefaultsFromSelectionVariant.description: Lets you to add default values for FilterBar using SelectionVariant annotation

smartVariantManagement.description: Controls whether smart variant management is active. Default is true.

liveMode.description: If liveMode is set, the search will be automatically triggered when a filter value is set.

variantManagementHidden.description:
If you set the flag to true, then standard variant management is not available in the app. The app name is displayed instead.
If you set the flag to false or if the flag is not at all contained in the manifest of the app, the standard variant management is available and can be enabled or disabled.

subTitleIfVariantMgmtHidden.description: You can choose an app-specific title by setting the corresponding value for the subTitleIfVariantMgmtHidden property.
subTitleIfVariantMgmtHidden.i18nClassification: TIT: Subtitle if variant management is hidden

dateSettings.description: Use to set date settings for fields in smart filter bar

showClearOnFB.description: Handles visibility of the Clear button on the FilterBar.

showFilterConfiguration.description: Handles visibility of the Filter button on the FilterBar.

showRestoreOnFB.description: Handles visibility of the Restore button on the FilterBar.

useDateRange.description: If set to true all date fields with filter restriction interval will be treated as DateTimeRange filters.

selectedValues.description: The selectedValues property is a set of standard date range values that you want to include or exclude.

exclude.description: The exclude property is set to True by default. This means excluding all values given as selectedValues from the list of date range filters. If the exclude property is set to False, the application shows only selected values in the list of date range filters.

selectedValues.description: The selectedValues property is a set of standard date range values that you want to include or exclude.

exclude.description: The exclude property is set to True by default. This means excluding all values given as selectedValues from the list of date range filters. If the exclude property is set to False, the application shows only selected values in the list of date range filters.

customDateRangeImplementation.description:
This property references a JS class, which you use to modify the date range value list. You can either remove standard data range values or add custom values.
The customDateRangeImplementation setting takes priority followed by filter and selectedValues when excluding date range types.

filter.description: You can use the filter settings to include and exclude specific date range values.

path.description: Choose 'key' to define filter values for single values of the date range, or 'category' to filter by a whole subset.

contains.description: The 'contains' string specifies a filter describing a set of values of the date range type.

equals.description: Defines a single value of the standard date range type.

exclude.description: The exclude property is set to True by default. This means excluding all values given as selectedValues from the list of date range filters. If the exclude property is set to False, the application shows only selected values in the list of date range filters.

defaultValue.description: You can set a default value for semantic date range.

operation.description: The operation property is the value that will be set for semantic date range.

showLegendButton.description: Controls the visibility of the legend button.

showDownloadButton.description: Controls the visibility of the chart download button.

showChartTypeSelectionButton.description: Controls the visibility of the chart type button.

ignoredChartTypes.description: Comma-separated value fields do not showup in the list of available chart types.

showDataLabel.description: Controls the visibility of the data label.

model.description: Links to the item in "models" section which provides additional information

entitySet.description: EntitySet used for bringing up the details displayed within the KPI tag/card

filterable.description: It ensures that KPI shows up as filterable

detailNavigation.description: Points to an element within "outbound" property of the "crossNavigation" section

groupId.description: To achieve faster end-to-end response time within analytical list page, enable batching of KPI by defining groupId in the KPI section of the descriptor configuration file
